gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਤੳੁ ਚੰਪਕ ਬੇਲ ਬਿਬਧ ਬਿਥਾਰ ਚਾਰੁ ਬਾਸਨਾ ਪ੍ਰਗਟ ਹੋਤ ਫੁਲ ਹੀ ਮੈ ਜਾੲਿ ਕੈ
transliteration: Jaisay Tau Chanpak Bayl Bibadh Bidaar Chaaru , Baasanaa Pragat Hot Dhul Hee Mai Jaai Kai ?
translation: Just as Champa (Michelia champacca) creeper is spread all over but its fragrance is felt only in its flowers.

gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਦ੍ਰੁਮ ਦੀਰਘ ਸ੍ਵਰੂਪ ਦੇਖੀਅੈ ਪ੍ਰਸਿਧ ਸ੍ਵਾਦ ਰਸ ਹੋਤ ਫਲ ਹੀ ਮੈ ਪੁਨ ਅਾੲਿ ਕੈ
transliteration: Jaisay Droum Deeragh Svaroop Daykheeai Prasidha , Svaad Ras Hot Dhal Hee Mai Poun Aai Kai ?
translation: Just as a tree is seen to spread all over but sweetness or bitterness of its character is known only from tasting its fruit.

gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਗੁਰ ਗ੍ਰਯਾਨ ਰਾਗ ਨਾਦ ਹਿਰਦੈ ਬਸਤ ਕਰਤ ਪ੍ਰਕਾਸ ਤਾਸ ਰਸਨਾ ਰਸਾੲਿ ਕੈ
transliteration: Jaisay Gur Gyaan Raag Naad Hiradai Basata , Karat Prakaas Taas Rasanaa Rasaai Kai ?
translation: Just as the Naam incantation of the True Guru, its melody and tune resides in the heart but its radiance is present on the tongue drenched with elixir-like Naam.

gurmukhi: ਤੈਸੇ ਘਟ ਘਟ ਬਿਖੈ ਪੂਰਨ ਬ੍ਹਮ ਰੂਪ ਜਾਨੀਅੈ ਪ੍ਰਤ੍ਰਯਛ ਮਹਾਂਪੁਰਖ ਮਨਾੲਿ ਕੈ ॥੫੮੬॥
transliteration: Taisay Ghat Ghat Bikhai Pooran Braham Roopa , Jaaneeai Pratyachh Mahaanpurakh Manaai Kai ?586?
translation: Similarly, the Supreme Lord is residing completely in everyone's heart but He can be realised only by taking the refuge of True Guru and great souls.  (586)
